_intro.title: Introduction
_intro.description:
Network Engineers design, implement, and maintain computer networks, including LANs, WANs, and cloud-based networks. They ensure network availability, performance, and security, while troubleshooting issues and optimizing connectivity.

Learn more from the following resources:

_roles.title: Key Roles & Responsibilities
_roles.description:
Network Engineers are responsible for:
- Designing and deploying network infrastructure
- Configuring routers, switches, and firewalls
- Monitoring network performance
- Implementing security policies and protocols

_learning.title: Learning Path
_learning.description:
**Foundational Skills:**
- TCP/IP, OSI Model, subnetting
- Networking devices and protocols

**Advanced Skills:**
- Cisco CCNA / CCNP certifications
- Network security and VPNs
- Cloud networking (AWS, Azure, GCP)

_career-growth.title: Career Growth
_career-growth.description: Network Engineers can advance to roles like Senior Network Engineer, Network Architect, or IT Manager, and may also specialize in network security or cloud infrastructure.
